alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 1:16PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Franklin County through 145 PM EDT... At 116 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Northwest Smith Mountain Lake to near Figsboro. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount... Sydnorsville... Snow Creek... Western Smith Mountain Lake... Union Hall... Sontag... and Northwest Smith Mountain Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
